content: quote: Originally posted by Dee187781: I would like to be deployed and I was wondering how to write a letter to higher that way I can be. If any one has any tips that will be helpful. What Branch of Service are you? We can direct you to better info that way maybe. There used to be a Form called "Form 1049 Change of Duty Station Request" that guys would fill out to volunteer for Viet Nam. All they had to do was fill out one of those, and they were gone within the week. Certainly there is something similar today - - Good Luck . . I guess - - Wandering and Wondering
quote: Originally posted by Dee187781: I would like to be deployed and I was wondering how to write a letter to higher that way I can be. If any one has any tips that will be helpful.

content: quote: Originally posted by Dee187781: I would like to be deployed and I was wondering how to write a letter to higher that way I can be. If any one has any tips that will be helpful. Hey - Your profile says Utah National Guard. What Unit? I was in the 1457th Engineers. My next door neighbor just left for the Sandbox last Friday - - All the units from Utah are home now. You'd have to augment a unit from another state most likely. Your first Sergeant should be able to get you information through Draper Headquarters... Wandering and Wondering
quote: Originally posted by Dee187781: I would like to be deployed and I was wondering how to write a letter to higher that way I can be. If any one has any tips that will be helpful.

content: I'm snagged... The only large group of Bee Hivers I know that are out of state now are Intel guys, but their flag is here.... Engineers, artillery, and field medical units are all back, along with all Air Guard and Air Reserves... There was a big deal about it in the news and on the TV... First time since 1990 that all the HHC Flags were back home. Wandering and Wondering

content: quote: Originally posted by Dee187781: I am in the ARNG if i can I will be going with the 144th medical company. So it sounds like you are new and waiting to train. As I said, you should be able to get all the information you want through your First Sgt and Utah Army National Guard Headquarters at Draper after you have completed all training. The chances of your unit being deployed to Afghanistan or Iraq are real enough, especially if things heat up. You could probably augment a Guard or Active Duty Unit already in country, if you wanted to pursue that. There are lists of needed augmentees coming out all the time to units from units already there or deploying. Again, check with your First Sergeant and PErsonnel for details - - Godd Luck - - Wandering and Wondering
quote: Originally posted by Dee187781: I am in the ARNG if i can I will be going with the 144th medical company.
reply: So it sounds like you are new and waiting to train. As I said, you should be able to get all the information you want through your First Sgt and Utah Army National Guard Headquarters at Draper after you have completed all training. The chances of your unit being deployed to Afghanistan or Iraq are real enough, especially if things heat up. You could probably augment a Guard or Active Duty Unit already in country, if you wanted to pursue that. There are lists of needed augmentees coming out all the time to units from units already there or deploying. Again, check with your First Sergeant and PErsonnel for details - - Godd Luck - - Wandering and Wondering
title: deploy

content: It’s still a 4187 “personnel action”…. Basically you ask to be deployed with a unit, a specific one that you know of, unit in county, or one that is near to their train-up date. What’s your MOS. That may have something to do with a unit talking or leaving you. “FSG”….??? First Sergeant (with diamond E-8) = 1SG, or “Top” if he says it’s ok….! Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!
reply: It’s still a 4187 “personnel action”…. Basically you ask to be deployed with a unit, a specific one that you know of, unit in county, or one that is near to their train-up date.
